intro: Euphorbia elegans, commonly known as the elegant spurge, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It is characterized by its succulent, ribbed stems and striking clusters of yellow flowers. The plant produces a milky sap that can be irritating to the skin. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens. Its unique appearance and low maintenance requirements make it a desirable addition to many landscapes.
